1 //Namespace
  2 var EarthServerGenericClient = EarthServerGenericClient || {};
  3 
  4 /**
  5  * @class Abstract base class for terrains.
  6  * @constructor
  7  */
  8 EarthServerGenericClient.AbstractTerrain = function()
  9 {
 10     /**
 11      * Stores the created appearances' names.
 12      * @type {Array}
 13      */
 14     var AppearanceDefined = [];
 15 
 16     /**
 17      * Stores the IDs of the materials to change the transparency.
 18      * @type {Array}
 19      */
 20     this.materialNodes = [];//Stores the IDs of the materials to change the transparency.
 21 
 22     /**
 23      * Creates a html canvas element out of the texture and removes the alpha values.
 24      * @param texture
 25      *      Texture to draw. Can be everything which can be rendered into a canvas.
 26      * @param index
 27      *      Index of the model using this canvas. Used to give the canvas a unique ID.
 28      * @returns {HTMLElement} The canvas element.
 29      */
 30     this.createCanvas = function(texture,index)
 31     {
 32         var canvasTexture = null;
 33 
 34         if( texture !== undefined)
 35         {
 36             canvasTexture = document.createElement('canvas');
 37             canvasTexture.style.display = "none";
 38             canvasTexture.setAttribute("id", "EarthServerGenericClient_Canvas"+index);
 39             canvasTexture.width = Math.pow(2, Math.round(Math.log(texture.width)/Math.log(2)));
 40             canvasTexture.height = Math.pow(2, Math.round(Math.log(texture.height)/Math.log(2)));
 41 
 42             var context = canvasTexture.getContext('2d');
 43             context.drawImage(texture, 0,0, canvasTexture.width, canvasTexture.height);
 44 
 45             var imageData = context.getImageData(0, 0, canvasTexture.width, canvasTexture.height);
 46             for (var i=0;i<imageData.data.length;i+=4)
 47             {
 48                 imageData.data[i+3]=255;
 49             }
 50             context.putImageData(imageData,0,0);
 51         }
 52         else
 53         {   console.log("Could not create Canvas, response Texture is empty."); }
 54 
 55         return canvasTexture;
 56     };
 57 
 58     /**
 59      * Calcs the needed numbers of chunks for the terrain for a specific chunk size.
 60      * @param width
 61      *      Width of the entire terrain.
 62      * @param height
 63      *      Height of the entire terrain.
 64      * @param chunkSize
 65      *      The size of one chunk.
 66      * @returns {Object literal} numChunksX: number, numChunksY: number, numChunks: number
 67      */
 68     this.calcNumberOfChunks = function(width,height,chunkSize)
 69     {
 70         var chunksInfo = {
 71             numChunksX: parseInt(width/chunkSize),
 72             numChunksY: parseInt(height/chunkSize),
 73             numChunks: 0
 74         };
 75 
 76         if(width%chunkSize!==0)
 77         {   chunksInfo.numChunksX++;  }
 78 
 79 
 80         if(height%chunkSize!==0)
 81         {   chunksInfo.numChunksY++;  }
 82 
 83         chunksInfo.numChunks = parseInt(chunksInfo.numChunksY*chunksInfo.numChunksX);
 84         return chunksInfo;
 85     };
 86 
 87     /**
 88      * This function calcs the needed information to build and place a chunk of a terrain.
 89      * @param index
 90      *      Index of the model using the terrain. Used for creating IDs.
 91      * @param chunkSize
 92      *      The desired size (count of values) of one chunk per axis.
 93      * @param chunkInfo
 94      *      This parameter uses an object that will be returned by calcNumberOfChunks().
 95      *      It contains the information about a terrain and its chunks (e.g. number of chunks on each axis).
 96      * @param currentChunk
 97      *      The index of the current chunk to be build.
 98      * @param terrainWidth
 99      *      Width of the whole terrain. Used to calc texture coordinates.
100      * @param terrainHeight
101      *      Height of the whole terrain. Used to calc texture coordinates.
102      * @returns {Object literal}
103      *      xpos: number, ypos: number, chunkWidth: number,
104      *      chunkHeight: number, terrainWidth: number,
105      *      terrainHeight: number, ID: number, modelIndex: number
106      */
107     this.createChunkInfo = function(index,chunkSize,chunkInfo,currentChunk,terrainWidth,terrainHeight)
108     {
109         var info = {
110             xpos:parseInt(currentChunk%chunkInfo.numChunksX)*(chunkSize-1),
111             ypos:parseInt(currentChunk/chunkInfo.numChunksX)*(chunkSize-1),
112             chunkWidth:0,
113             chunkHeight:0,
114             terrainWidth: terrainWidth,
115             terrainHeight: terrainHeight,
116             ID: currentChunk,
117             modelIndex: index
118         };
119 
120         if( currentChunk%chunkInfo.numChunksX === (chunkInfo.numChunksX-1) )
121         {   info.chunkWidth = terrainWidth - parseInt((chunkInfo.numChunksX-1)*chunkSize);   }
122         else
123         {   info.chunkWidth = chunkSize;   }
124 
125         if( currentChunk >= chunkInfo.numChunks - chunkInfo.numChunksX)
126         {   info.chunkHeight = terrainHeight - parseInt((chunkInfo.numChunksY-1)*chunkSize); }
127         else
128         {   info.chunkHeight = chunkSize  }
129 
130         return info;
131     };
132 
133     /**
134      * Returns a height map part from the given height map specified in the info parameter.
135      * @param info
136      *      Which part of the heightmap should be returned. In this case the parameter is an object literal
137      *      and uses the following attributes: xpos: number, ypos: number, chunkWidth: number, chunkHeight: number
138      * @param  hm
139      *      The heightmap from which the parts is extracted.
140      * @returns {Array}
141      *      Returns a 2D Array, use it as follows Array[chunk height][chunk width].
142      * @throws If any error occurs, the function will return null.
143      */
144     this.getHeightMap = function(info,hm)
145     {
146         try
147         {
148             var heightmapPart = new Array(info.chunkHeight);
149             for(var i=0; i<info.chunkHeight; i++)
150             {
151                 heightmapPart[i] = new Array(info.chunkWidth);
152                 for(var j=0; j<info.chunkWidth; j++)
153                 {
154                     heightmapPart[i][j] = hm[info.xpos+j][info.ypos+i];
155                 }
156             }
157             return heightmapPart;
158         }
159         catch(error)
160         {
161             console.log('AbstractTerrain::getHeightMap(): ' + error);
162             return null;
163         }
164     };
165 
166     /**
167      * Collects all material nodes of the terrain and changes each transparency attribute.
168      * @param value
169      *      Transparency value between 0 (full visible) and 1 (invisible).
170      */
171     this.setTransparency = function(value)
172     {
173         for(var k=0;k<this.materialNodes.length;k++)
174         {
175             var mat =  document.getElementById(this.materialNodes[k]);
176             if( mat !== null)
177             {   mat.setAttribute("transparency",value); }
178             else
179             {   console.log("Material with ID " +this.materialNodes[k] + " not found.");    }
180         }
181     };
182 
183     /**
184      * Deletes all saved material IDs. Use this function if you remove old material from the dom.
185      * E.g. for ProgressiveTerrain.
186      */
187     this.clearMaterials = function()
188     {
189        this.materialNodes = [];
190     };
191 
192 
193     /**
194      * This function handles the creation and usage of the appearances. It can be called for every shape or LOD that should use a canvasTexture.
195      * It returns the amount of appearances specified. For every name only one appearance exits, every other uses it.
196      * @param AppearanceName
197      *      Name of the appearance. If this name is not set in the array, it will be registered.
198      *      In the case the name is already set, the existing one will be used.
199      * @param AppearanceCount
200      *      Number of appearance to be created. E.g. the LODs use a bunch of three appearance nodes.
201      * @param modelIndex
202      *      Index of the model using this appearance.
203      * @param canvasTexture
204      *      Canvas element to be used in the appearance as texture.
205      * @param transparency
206      *      Transparency of the appearance.
207      * @returns {Array}
208      *      Array of appearance nodes.
209      *      @throws If any error occurs, the function will return null.
210      */
211     this.getAppearances = function (AppearanceName, AppearanceCount, modelIndex, canvasTexture, transparency) {
212         try {
213             var appearances = [AppearanceCount];
214             for (var i = 0; i < AppearanceCount; i++) {
215                 var appearance = document.createElement('Appearance');
216                 appearance.setAttribute('sortType', 'transparent');
217 
218                 if (AppearanceDefined[AppearanceName] != undefined)//use the already defined appearance
219                 {
220                     appearance.setAttribute("use", AppearanceDefined[AppearanceName]);
221                 }
222                 else    //create a new appearance with the given parameter
223                 {
224                     AppearanceDefined[AppearanceName] = AppearanceName;
225                     appearance.setAttribute("id", AppearanceDefined[AppearanceName]);
226                     appearance.setAttribute("def", AppearanceDefined[AppearanceName]);
227 
228                     var texture = document.createElement('Texture');
229                     texture.setAttribute('hideChildren', 'true');
230                     texture.setAttribute("repeatS", 'true');
231                     texture.setAttribute("repeatT", 'true');
232 
233                     texture.appendChild(canvasTexture);
234 
235                     var imageTransform = document.createElement('TextureTransform');
236                     imageTransform.setAttribute("scale", "1,-1");
237 
238                     var material = document.createElement('material');
239                     material.setAttribute("specularColor", "0.25,0.25,0.25");
240                     material.setAttribute("diffuseColor", "1 1 1");
241                     material.setAttribute('transparency', transparency);
242                     material.setAttribute('ID',AppearanceName+"_mat");
243                     //Save this material ID to change transparency during runtime
244                    this.materialNodes.push( AppearanceName+"_mat");
245 
246                     appearance.appendChild(material);
247                     appearance.appendChild(imageTransform);
248                     appearance.appendChild(texture);
249 
250                     texture = null;
251                     imageTransform = null;
252                     material = null;
253                 }
254                 appearances[i] = appearance;
255             }
256             return appearances;
257         }
258         catch (error) {
259             console.log('AbstractTerrain::getAppearances(): ' + error);
260             return null;
261         }
262     };
263 };
264 
265 
266 
267 
268 
269 /**
270  * @class This terrain should receive multiple insertLevel calls. It removes the old version
271  * and replace it with the new data. It can be used for progressive loading.
272  * Example: WCPSDemAlpha with progressive loading using the progressiveWCPSImageLoader.
273  *
274  * @augments EarthServerGenericClient.AbstractTerrain
275  * @param index
276  *      Index of the model using this terrain.
277  * @constructor
278  */
279 EarthServerGenericClient.ProgressiveTerrain = function(index)
280 {
281     /**
282      * General information about the amount of chunks needed to build the terrain.
283      * @type {Object}
284      */
285     var chunkInfo;
286     /**
287      * Size of one chunk. Chunks at the borders can be smaller.
288      * 256*256 (2^16) is the max size because of only 16 bit indices.
289      * @type {number}
290      */
291     var chunkSize = 256;
292     /**
293      * The canvas that holds the received image.
294      * @type {HTMLElement}
295      */
296     var canvasTexture;
297     /**
298      * Counter of the inserted levels.
299      * @type {number}
300      */
301     var currentData = 0;
302 
303     /**
304      * Insert one data level into the scene. The old elevation grid will be removed and one new build.
305      * @param root
306      *      Dom Element to append the terrain to.
307      * @param data
308      *      Received Data of the Server request.
309      */
310     this.insertLevel = function(root,data)
311     {
312         canvasTexture = this.createCanvas(data.texture,index);
313         chunkInfo     = this.calcNumberOfChunks(data.width,data.height,chunkSize);
314 
315         //Remove old Materials of the deleted children
316         this.clearMaterials();
317 
318         for(var currentChunk=0; currentChunk< chunkInfo.numChunks; currentChunk++)
319         {
320             try
321             {
322                 //Build all necessary information and values to create a chunk
323                 var info = this.createChunkInfo(index,chunkSize,chunkInfo,currentChunk,data.width,data.height);
324                 var hm = this.getHeightMap(info,data.heightmap);
325                 var appearance = this.getAppearances("TerrainApp_"+index+"_"+currentData,1,index,canvasTexture,data.transparency);
326 
327                 var transform = document.createElement('Transform');
328                 transform.setAttribute("translation", info.xpos + " 0 " + info.ypos);
329                 transform.setAttribute("scale", "1.0 1.0 1.0");
330 
331                 new ElevationGrid(transform,info, hm, appearance);
332 
333                 root.appendChild(transform);
334 
335                 //Delete vars avoid circular references
336                 info = null;
337                 hm = null;
338                 appearance = null;
339                 transform = null;
340             }
341             catch(error)
342             {
343                 alert('Terrain::CreateNewChunk(): ' + error);
344             }
345         }
346         currentData++;
347         canvasTexture = null;
348         chunkInfo = null;
349 
350         EarthServerGenericClient_MainScene.reportProgress(index);
351     };
352 };
353 EarthServerGenericClient.ProgressiveTerrain.inheritsFrom( EarthServerGenericClient.AbstractTerrain);
354 
355 
356 /**
357  * @class This terrain build up a LOD with 3 levels of the received data.
358  * @param root
359  *      Dom Element to append the terrain to.
360  * @param data
361  *      Received Data of the Server request.
362  * @param index
363  *      Index of the model that uses this terrain.
364  * @augments EarthServerGenericClient.AbstractTerrain
365  * @constructor
366  */
367 EarthServerGenericClient.LODTerrain = function(root, data,index)
368 {
369     /**
370      * Distance to change between full and 1/2 resolution.
371      * @type {number}
372      */
373     var lodRange1       = 2000;
374     /**
375      * Distance to change between 1/2 and 1/4 resolution.
376      * @type {number}
377      */
378     var lodRange2       = 10000;
379 
380     /**
381      * The canvas that holds the received image.
382      * @type {HTMLElement}
383      */
384     var canvasTexture   = this.createCanvas( data.texture,index);
385     /**
386      * Size of one chunk. Chunks at the borders can be smaller.
387      * We want to build 3 chunks for the LOD with different resolution but the same size on the screen.
388      * With 253 values the length of the most detailed chunk is 252.
389      * The second chunk has 127 values and the length of 126. With a scale of 2 it's back to the size of 252.
390      * The third chunk has 64 values and the length if 63. With a scale of 4 it's also back to the size 252.
391      * @type {number}
392      */
393     var chunkSize = 253;
394     /**
395      * General information about the number of chunks needed to build the terrain.
396      * @type {number}
397      */
398     var chunkInfo       = this.calcNumberOfChunks(data.width,data.height,chunkSize);
399 
400     /**
401      * Builds the terrain and appends into the scene.
402      */
403     this.createTerrain= function()
404     {
405         for(var currentChunk=0; currentChunk< chunkInfo.numChunks;currentChunk++)
406         {
407             try
408             {
409                 //Build all necessary information and values to create a chunk
410                 var info = this.createChunkInfo(index,chunkSize,chunkInfo,currentChunk,data.width,data.height);
411                 var hm = this.getHeightMap(info,data.heightmap);
412                 var appearance = this.getAppearances("TerrainApp_"+index,3,index,canvasTexture,data.transparency);
413 
414                 var transform = document.createElement('Transform');
415                 transform.setAttribute("translation", info.xpos + " 0 " + info.ypos);
416                 transform.setAttribute("scale", "1.0 1.0 1.0");
417 
418                 var lodNode = document.createElement('LOD');
419                 lodNode.setAttribute("Range", lodRange1 + ',' + lodRange2);
420                 lodNode.setAttribute("id", 'lod' + info.ID);
421 
422                 new ElevationGrid(lodNode,info, hm, appearance);
423                 transform.appendChild(lodNode);
424                 root.appendChild(transform);
425 
426                 //Delete vars avoid circular references
427                 info = null;
428                 hm = null;
429                 appearance = null;
430                 transform = null;
431                 lodNode = null;
432             }
433             catch(error)
434             {
435                 alert('Terrain::CreateNewChunk(): ' + error);
436             }
437         }
438         canvasTexture = null;
439         chunkInfo = null;
440 
441         EarthServerGenericClient_MainScene.reportProgress(index);
442     };
443 };
444 EarthServerGenericClient.LODTerrain.inheritsFrom( EarthServerGenericClient.AbstractTerrain);
